body.p: There are a number of HPE Helion Public Cloud services available for you:

ul.li: Block storage: Allows you to enable additional volumes to Compute instances.

CDN: Content inside HPE Helion Public Cloud Object Storage can easily be cached on servers in metropolitan areas all over the world to speed client access to them by removing much of the network latency.
Compute: A method for you to instantiate virtual servers on publicly accessible physical machines hosted in HPE data centers.
DNS: A managed domain name service that features anycast routing hosted by HP.
Identity service: One-stop authentication for all HPE Helion Public Cloud Service offerings.
Object storage: A way to store and retrieve objects in a highly redundant cluster of publicly accessible physical machines hosted in HPE data centers.
Relational Database: Provides you with a simplified method for creation and management of MySQL database instances.

body.p: The following HPE Helion Public Cloud services are now in private beta; follow the links to sign up and begin trying them out!

ul.li: Load Balancer - A managed service enabling automatic traffic routing to multiple back end servers hosted by HP.Note: This service requires activation while in private beta; please request access on our sign-up page. Service use is free of charge during the private beta period.
